text: Robert Byron Bird (February 5, 1924 â€“ November 13, 2020) was an American chemical engineer. He was professor emeritus in the Department of Chemical Engineering at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. He was known for his research in transport phenomena of non-Newtonian fluids. Bird was a recipient of the National Medal of Science in 1987. He was born in Bryan, Texas. Bird died on November 13, 2020 at the age of 96. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Engineers from Massachusetts Category:American chemical engineers Category:Academics from Massachusetts Category:Scientists from Texas Category:Academics from Texas
title: Robert Byron Bird
